The invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipe line, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas at least during individual intervals to a substantially higher pressure (excess pressure) than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by the heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and obtaining the further cooling to the desired exit temperature by expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure. A compressor station for a gas pipeline for carrying out the above-described method includes at least one compressor for compressing gas, at least one heat exchanger for cooling compressed gas, additionally valve-controlled pipelines for connecting the compressor and the heat exchanger to one another and to the gas pipeline, as well as control units for controlling the compressor and the valves. The invention starts from the fact that it is known to carry out the compression of a gas supplied at an entry pressure below the nominal pressure (rated pressure of the gas pipeline) to an increased pressure, wherein the compression can be carried out in a single stage or in multiple stages in compressors which are connected in series. Between the compressor stages and particularly after the last compressor stage, cooling by heat exchange takes place (usually air/gas heat exchange), in order to reach the required lower exit temperature of at most 0° C., preferably -5° C., for the re-entry of the compressed gas into the gas pipeline. During the warmer period of the year, in which the use of re-cooling units was necessary in the past for ensuring the required exit temperature, the present invention provides for a different type of cooling. The present invention utilizes the known physical effect according to which a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, either by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work. In order to ensure the required exit pressure or nominal pressure at the exit of the compressor station, the present invention provides that the gas to be transported is compressed to an excess pressure which is substantially above the exit pressure, for example, 10 to 50 bar above the exit pressure, to carry out at the end of the single-stage or multiple-stage compression a cooling by heat exchange, particularly by air/gas heat exchange, and subsequently to expand the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure. <summary>Summary of the Source Document</summary>

1. The source document discusses a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure. The system can be utilized in various applications, including the automotive, computer, electronic instrumentation, and any industry where forced air movement is used as a temperature controlling medium.

2. The document outlines a cooling fan assembly that includes a motor for rotating a fan blade by way of a motor output shaft. The motor is typically an electric motor, but it can be an electric motor or a non-electric motor. The motor carrier is integrated with the motor to form an integrated unit.

3. The document describes the mounting of the cooling fan assembly to a panel, which is typically a sheet-like stationary member. The panel provides the mounting interface for supporting the cooling fan assembly.

4. The document explains that the motor carrier is integrally formed with the motor to form an integrated unit. The height of the turned-out portions of the mounting legs is less than or equal to the height of the recessed portions of the panel, allowing adjacent components to directly abut the exterior of the enclosure.

5. The document describes the steps for installing the cooling fan assembly. The initial positioning of the cooling fan assembly is shown in a load position, where the turned-out portions of the mounting legs are inserted into the enlarged openings of the opening. The compressed force of the spring member is applied to move the turned-out portions fully into recesses, while the rotating force repositions the resilient legs into an intermediate opening.

6. The document explains the process of moving the cooling fan assembly from the load position to the partially installed position. The resilient legs enter into a third portion of the opening called the residual opening, which is smaller than the enlarged opening but not as small as the intermediate opening. The compressed spring member urges the turned-out portions of the resilient legs against the exterior surface of the panel.

7. The document concludes by discussing the subject matter sought to be afforded protection by the invention, which extends to the subject matter defined in the appended claims (including all fair equivalents thereof).

<summary>Field of the Invention</summary>
The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage which is produced as such under the influence of forming production steps from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and in each case provided to guide rolling bodies. The invention furthermore also relates to a method for manufacturing such a rolling body guide cage.

<summary>Background</summary>
The prior art discloses a ball bearing cage which is composed of two axially profiled ring elements. The two ring elements are of identical design and are axially profiled in such a manner that they form spherical cap pockets which are arranged in succession in the circumferential direction and which are connected in each case via bridge portions. The two ring elements are composed in such a manner that they contact one another via their bridge portions, wherein the in each case corresponding spherical cap pockets which face one another then jointly form ball guide pockets into which in each case a ball can be inserted. The two ring elements which contact one another via the bridge portions are welded to one another in the region of the bridge portions by spot weld points. In order to manufacture the ring elements, these are punched out from a sheet metal material and formed in a forming tool such that they obtain the axial profiling required to form the ball guide pockets.

<summary>Summary</summary>
The object of the invention is to reduce the production costs which arise during the manufacture of rolling body guide cages. According to the invention, this object is achieved by a rolling body guide cage with a ring element which is produced from a sheet metal material and has an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures which are arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, the ring element being composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and are connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling. 

The invention has been shown to be particularly advantageous in particular in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm since the process costs associated with the formation of three weld joints are, at this diameter, already substantially below the material costs of the cutting waste which has hitherto arisen.

Summary:
The present methods and systems provide for obtaining, processing, and transmitting information related to providing customer service at a customer service location. One embodiment includes requesting at least one set of coordinates associated with the customer service location; accessing a technician server to direct a global satellite positioning system to obtain the set of coordinates for the customer service location; obtaining the coordinates and updating one or more databases with the coordinates. The coordinates may include at least one of a latitude and a longitude associated with the customer service location. The system also includes an input device configured for use by a service technician at the customer service location; a technician server for receiving data transmissions from the input device; and a global positioning satellite system for determining the set of coordinates associated with the input device. The system further includes a mapping system operatively associated with the input device for generating travel directions based on the "to" and "from" coordinates.

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. The invention addresses the issue of accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating point processors.
2. The invention includes a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation by considering the difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals.
3. The technique reduces the time to execute the effective subtraction operation by dividing the operation into five major steps.
4. The invention uses a difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
5. The invention provides a floating point execution that includes an effective subtraction operation.
6. The invention includes a detection and logic unit to determine the correct final fraction result.
7. The invention includes a shift and selection logic unit to select the correct final fraction result based on the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

1. The present invention addresses the problem of mislabeling of specimen vials, which poses a significant risk to patient safety and liability for hospitals.
2. The invention involves a method for tracking and collecting blood and medical specimen samples, including a step to store patient identification codes, such as patient barcode numbers, in a relational database.
3. The method includes steps to place an order for blood and medical specimen samples, enter the order into a computer, and select a specimen container with a unique barcode number.
4. The barcode number is used to identify the specimen container, which is then used to collect the specimen.
5. The method also includes steps to determine if the barcode number is related to the same patient, and if so, to correct any discrepancies in the barcode number relationship.
6. The method also includes steps to generate a signal to acquire the specimen and place it in the container, and to store the signal in the database.
7. The invention also includes a system for tracking and collecting blood and medical specimen samples, including a standalone or networked computer and a barcode scanner to read barcode numbers.
8. The system can be implemented in any suitable and/or desirable manner, utilizing one or more standalone or networked computers and local or remote computer storage, all connected by a wired or wireless network.
9. The invention provides a failsafe, zero defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the cost of vial labels and associated printers, and reducing the need for staff labor in dealing with vial labels.
10. The invention can be implemented in any suitable and/or desirable manner, utilizing one or more standalone or networked computers and local or remote computer storage, all connected by a wired or wireless network.

<summary>Overview of the Voice-Activated Distance Measuring Device</summary>

1. The device is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides golf course information and other relevant data to golfers.
2. It uses voice recognition technology and GPS technology to measure distances and other golf course parameters.
3. The device incorporates voice synthesis technology to provide audible output and distance and other information to the user.
4. The device can accept verbal or electrical commands to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, and other golf player needs.
5. It can also accept verbal or any other data input and memorize and compute this information to provide golf player recommendations.
6. The device can be used for various applications such as hiking, surveyors, hunters, and other sports.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

1. The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
2. The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
3. The invention creates customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, where such customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory based parameter onto stricter logic based parameter.
4. The invention provides a system and method of checking design rules to determine whether or not a logic part (all non-memory devices that have to satisfy TLR) of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules (as specified in a TLR document) and the memory part of a mask pattern data obeys memory rules (in this case, logic rules that are modified appropriately for a memory area to accommodate the more liberal values available for such regions).
5. The invention helps users filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block, and further helps pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.
6. The invention provides a program that can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating customized rules and performing design rule checks on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.
7. The invention is applicable to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks. The only modification required to implement the present invention using conventional GDS formatted data is that different types of memory should be identified in some way, such as with different memory ID layers to defined core bit cell regions. This can be done in advance, by modifying the GDS data file directly, by adding a distinct memory ID layer on top of each type of memory to identify such different respective memory region types.

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to obtain resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor to permit identification of rotor defects. The apparatus comprises a test head for accepting and causing relative angular movement between the rotor and test head and includes exciting means for magnetizing the rotor during such angular movement in response to an alternating current. Voltage sensing means is provided for generating a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations generated by the rotor in response to the magnetization by the exciting means. Current sensing means is provided for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor and for generating a current signal representative thereof. Processing means is provided for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor responsive to the voltage signal and current signal. Additionally, skew sensing means may be provided for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor and for generating an effective skew signal responsive thereto. The apparatus also includes a skew winding portion of a test head for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor and for generating an effective skew signal responsive thereto. The apparatus further includes a rotor clutch mechanism for manually rotating the rotor within the test head to obtain a peak power measurement (i.e., power into the rotor) using a pick-up coil. By using the current measurement, the impedance of the rotor can be obtained, but separate resistance, reactance and skew information can not be determined. The apparatus also includes a rotor clutch mechanism for manually rotating the rotor within the test head to obtain a peak power measurement (i.e., power into the rotor) using a pick-up coil. <summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention provides an identification card comprising a core layer made of silica-filled polyolefin, an antenna fixed to the first side of the core layer, an integrated circuit chip electrically connected to the antenna, and a bottom sheet comprising a silica-filled polyolefin attached to the first side of the core by a first adhesive layer. The invention also includes an alkyd resin spid containing an anti-binding agent printed on the first side of the core layer, a first laminate layer attached to the second side of the core layer by a second adhesive layer, and a second laminate layer attached to the bottom sheet by a third adhesive layer. The invention differs from the prior art in that the core layer is made of a transparent material, the antenna is fixed to the first side of the core layer, and the bottom sheet is made of a transparent material. The invention also includes a protective layer on the image-receiving layer, which protects the relatively fragile electronic components from damage. The invention provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card with an antenna and chip incorporated into the body of the card, which protects these electronic components from damage.

<summary>Overview of the Invention</summary>

The invention addresses the problem of implementing a queue in a memory, particularly a FIFO-type queue (First In First Out). The solution involves using a tree-shaped data structure with a header node to establish the queue, where the header node contains pointers to the leaf nodes of the end and beginning of the queue. The header node also includes an inversion bit that indicates the direction of the queue. The queue can be inverted in constant time and space, and updates are made faster than previously. The invention also allows for the implementation of a double-ended queue, where deletions can be made from the end of the queue. The invention is applicable to functional memories, where updates are made in such a way that first the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating is copied, and thereafter the update is made in the copied data.

Summary:
The present invention provides methods for building embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, including DRAM and logic circuits. The key advantage is that EPROM devices can be manufactured using existing DRAM technologies, reducing the cost of EPROM devices. The main disadvantage is that writing data to EPROM devices can take longer than writing to floating gate devices, which can be solved by various methods.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The invention relates to a technique for easily and quickly determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control.
2. The method of determining feedback gain according to the invention, as schematically shown in FIG. 1, comprises a first step of provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, a second step of executing feedback control by using the provisionally determined feedback gain, a third step of detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step, a fourth step of calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, a fifth step of executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and a sixth step of calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value according to the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value obtained through the fifth step.
3. This method permits a feedback gain providing for a suitable evaluation value to be calculated on the basis of the relation between feedback gain value and evaluation value, and it is thus possible to determine a feedback gain which can realize a suitable feedback control characteristic quickly and reliably.
4. Particularly, in case of determining the proportional gain, in the fourth step, the ratio between the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis and the length of the time axis is calculated as the evaluation value, and in the sixth step, a feedback gain value providing for the minimum evaluation value is calculated.
5. The proportional gain is a factor which influences the stability of control. The stability of control can be evaluated from the extent of variations of the error, and thus the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis is suited for evaluating the proportional gain. Thus, by using the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis as the evaluation value, it is possible to obtain quickly and accurately a value of the proportional gain that provides for the optimum stability.
6. In case of determining the integral gain, in the fourth step, the evaluation value is calculated by integrating the error, and in the sixth step, a value of feedback gain that provides for an evaluation value closest to zero is calculated.
7. The integral gain is a factor influencing the accuracy of control. The integral of the error reflects the accuracy of control, and is thus suited for evaluating the integral gain

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies, particularly for friction clutches.
2. The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and means for moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring to engage the driven disc assembly.
3. The apparatus includes a microprocessor for controlling the spin checking process and generating an external indication to the operator.
4. The apparatus automatically measures the distance between the driven disc assembly and the stationary ring, and compares this distance with a standard value to determine if the assembly is within specified tolerances.
5. The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator, such as a visible alert or a display, to indicate whether the assembly is good or bad.
6. The apparatus minimizes the chances of operator error by automatically measuring the assembly's warpage and generating an external indication.
7. The apparatus is designed to be used in a test environment, such as a vehicle, to ensure the assembly's quality.
8. The apparatus is compact and easy to install, making it suitable for use in various applications.
9. The invention is applicable to various types of friction clutches, including those used in vehicles, industrial machinery, and aerospace applications.

<summary>Summary:</summary> 

1. The present invention addresses the challenge of accurately estimating an age from a face, particularly in the context of face age-estimation, by leveraging contourlet appearance models (CAM) and age classifiers. 
2. The method involves extracting landmark points from the face image and applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to generate a feature vector. This vector is then used to classify the face into different age groups based on the extracted features.
3. The method also includes an aging function to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
4. The method is designed to be computationally efficient and scalable, making it suitable for real-time applications.
5. The method is applicable to various applications, including automated control, surveillance systems, and homeland security technologies.
6. The method is particularly useful for businesses requiring age recognition, such as convenience stores, restaurants, and hotels.
7. The method is also applicable in homeland security technologies, criminal identification, and management of electronic documents and customer relationships.
8. The method is designed to be user-friendly, allowing for real-time face age-estimation without requiring user cooperation.
9. The method is scalable and can handle large datasets efficiently, making it suitable for various applications.

The matrix display device according to the present invention is a display device that combines two images, one from a night vision sensor and the other from an infrared sensor. The first image is monochrome, with a definition of 2000×2000 pixels, and the second image is monochrome, with a lower resolution of 480×480 pixels, and the third image is graphical information (icons, cursors, menus, etc.), or textual information (position, time, etc.). The matrix display device combines the two images in a way that the first image is displayed on the matrix of 2000×2000 pixels with one pixel out of every four (the pixels P2) omitted, and the second image is displayed on the remaining pixels P2, by applying the signal S22 (intensity signal corresponding to the second image). The intensity correction is applied to the first image from a certain threshold of intensity of the second image only, and the parameter a is appropriately determined. The combined display of the three images is produced in a way that the first image is displayed on the matrix of 2000×2000 pixels with two pixels in every four (the pixels P2 and P3) omitted, and the second image is displayed on the pixels P2, by applying the signal S33 (intensity signal corresponding to the third image). The third image is displayed on the pixels P3, by applying the signal S33 (intensity signal corresponding to the third image). The intensity correction is applied to the first image from a certain threshold of intensity of the second image only, and the parameter a is appropriately determined. The combined display of the three images is produced in a way that the first image is displayed on the matrix of 2000×2000 pixels with two pixels in every four (the pixels P2 and P3) omitted, and the second image is displayed on the pixels P2, by applying the signal S33 (intensity signal corresponding to the third image). The third image is displayed on the pixels P3, by applying the signal S33 (intensity signal corresponding to the third image).

<summary>Summary:</summary>
1. The invention addresses a mobile identification transmitter for an access and/or ignition control system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system, having a housing in which electronics and a communication means are arranged, wherein the communication means can be brought into communication with a communication means of the security system located on board the motor vehicle.
2. The invention provides a payment element that can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter by the user if necessary, and the payment element can be removably fastened in the receptacle of the housing, thereby ensuring that the user can carry out various payment actions, such as at a gas station, in a shopping center, etc.
3. The invention improves the security of the identification transmitter by providing a secure and reliable communication means with the payment system, which can be used for keyless activation of the security system of the motor vehicle.
4. The invention includes a payment element with a microprocessor that can communicate with the payment system, and can execute remote financial transactions such as loading a certain amount of money onto the payment element or debiting a defined amount from the payment element.
5. The invention includes a carrier that can be included in the identification transmitter, and the carrier is removably fastened in the receptacle of the housing, thereby ensuring that the carrier can be reliably held in the receptacle of the housing and prevent moisture, dirt particles, etc. from penetrating into the receptacle.

1. The imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, becomes inactive when not in use. When the device becomes inactive for a long period of time, the device is often put into a "sleep mode" in which most of the electric power is cut off to save energy.  
2. The toner used in such an imaging device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge (also known as tribo). A toner concentration (TC) sensor measures the concentration of the toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner, and based on the output of the TC sensor, a toner dispenser may adjust the supply of toner to increase the concentration of the toner when the concentration of toner is low.  
3. If the imaging device is inactive for a long period of time, such as from the end of a business day to the next morning, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease. The tribo charge greatly affects the image quality in an imaging operation. Therefore, the image quality in an imaging operation after a delayed period may become inconsistent and darker than the image quality during normal or continual use.  
4. The exemplary embodiments address these and other issues. For example, in various exemplary embodiments, a method for charging a toner used in an imaging device may include determining one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.  
5. In various exemplary embodiments, a method for charging toner used in an imaging device may include determining one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device, measuring a toner charge level when the printing machine is recovered from the inactivity, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on a difference between the measured charge of toner and a predetermined level.  
6. In various exemplary embodiments, an apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device may include an inactivity determining section that determines one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device, and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level.  
7. In various exemplary embodiments, the above-described method and/or apparatus may be included in a xerographic machine.  
8. These and other features and advantages of the disclosed embodiments are described in, or are apparent from, the following detailed description of various exemplary embodiments.

1. The invention provides a system and method for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object.
2. The system comprises a transmitter and a receiver, with the transmitter generating alternating currents in the objects and the receiver sensing magnetic fields associated with these currents.
3. The system can improve the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object, such as a buried pipe or cable, in the presence of an adjacent object.
4. The method involves producing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects and moving the receiver to detect the magnetic fields associated with these currents.
5. The system can be used to locate and trace one concealed object more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
6. The invention alleviates the problem of distortion in the output signal characteristic when a second cable is present adjacent to the first, by using a transmitter with antennae spaced a few feet apart and driving currents in the objects.

1. The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch fiber optic ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
2. The preferred embodiment of the present invention, illustrated in FIG. 1, includes a ring topology with a hub assembly with remote pumping and a hub assembly without remote pumping, each serially coupled by an optical fiber cable trunk and configured in a ring topology.
3. The branch assembly in the preferred embodiment of the present invention consists of a cable station and a light emitting power source, each optically coupled to a branch fiber optic cable. The branch fiber optic cable is optically coupled to a branching unit, which maintains optical fiber cable trunk continuity and is also optically coupled to the branch fiber optic cable.
4. The branch fiber optic cable is optically coupled to the cable station, and the branch fiber optic cable transports bidirectional optical communications signals between the cable station and the optical fiber cable trunk.
5. The branch fiber optic cable is predominantly submerged, and much of the submerged branch fiber optic cable is located in shallow water, making it susceptible to damage from commercial boating and shipping. The optical fiber cable trunk is typically located more than one hundred miles from the coastline and is therefore not as susceptible to failure.
6. The branch fiber optic cable is coupled at its other end to a branching unit, which maintains continuity along the optical fiber cable trunk and allows for insertion of new signals and extraction of existing signals via the branch fiber optic cable.
7. The key element of the present invention concerns the light emitting power source, which is coupled onto the branch fiber optic cable, either through the cable station itself or directly onto the branch fiber optic cable. If coupled directly onto the branch fiber optic cable, the coupling may be accomplished either coterminously with the coupling for the cable station or at some point along the branch fiber optic cable between the branching unit and the cable station.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The invention provides a cover plate device that can be installed over a wall-mounted electrical wiring device without exposing visible fasteners, allowing for a finished look without exposed fasteners. The device includes a two-part attachment member and a cover plate member with no fastener holes, allowing for quick and easy installation and removal. The cover plate device can be used with any number of wiring devices, including rocker switches, receptacles, and duplex receptacles, and can be easily installed or removed.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>
The present invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of annular strips that are concentrically nested and essentially enclose one another in a tight manner. The strips are suitable for various positions relative to the screen, enabling the displaying screen to be viewed from different angles without hindrance. The strips are provided with hook elements or locking elements to ensure reliable folding-in and folding-out of the device. The invention also includes a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device, which can be fixed to virtually any type of monitor, either flat or single- or double-curved front. The strips are made of solid design, with an adapter member for easy attachment to monitors of various types. The total length of the strips is 16 mm, with the thickness decreasing in the axial direction, providing a positive locking for the strips in the position shown in FIG. 3. The strips are also modified to provide a bent profile section with integrated hooks and projection, improving positioning of the strips relative to each other.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The present invention discloses a solution for automatically informing a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when that rate likely exceeds a rate that a listener can understand. This can be achieved by determining a speaking rate threshold for the listener and comparing it against the speaker's speaking rate. The speaking rate threshold can be based on a listening rate, estimated or known, of the listener. The speaker can be informed to slow down by an activation of a sensory mechanism, such as a vibration, a tone, a flashing LED, a displayed message, a speech message, a haptic or tactile indicator, or a wireless transceiver. The invention can be implemented in various aspects, including a method for facilitating comprehension during a discourse bed, a device for facilitating understanding between discourse participants, and a service agent for facilitating understanding between discourse participants. The invention can also be implemented as a program for controlling computing equipment to implement the functions described herein, or a program for enabling computing equipment to perform processes corresponding to the steps disclosed herein. The invention can be embodied in hardware, software, or a combination of hardware and software, and can be embedded in a computer program product.

The invention provides a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, in order to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane on which the processes are projected. The device also includes a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression. The device further includes a sawtooth generator synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and to control the vertical deviation of the beam. The invention aims to provide a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a high and selectable resolution in time, which can be controlled and analyzed via a programmable counter. The device is particularly suitable for recording IR, UV or X-ray pictures.

The present invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. The key concepts of the invention are:

1. Integration of multimedia capabilities with circuit switched calls: The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and routes it to a multimedia server, which then handles the call by integrating the voice and multimedia components.

2. Blending of voice and multimedia calls: The invention allows for the blending of voice and multimedia calls into a single communication session, which can be used for voice and multimedia services.

3. Integration with SIP-enabled networks: The invention is well suited for use with SIP-enabled networks, as it can be integrated with packet-based approaches.

4. Support for multimedia services: The invention supports multimedia services such as instant messaging, video conferencing, and other multimedia applications.

5. Backward compatibility: The invention is well suited for use with SIP-enabled networks, as it can be integrated with packet-based approaches.

6. Integration with Intelligent Networks (IN): The invention can be integrated with Intelligent Networks (IN) to provide more advanced multimedia capabilities.

7. Backward compatibility: The invention is well suited for use with SIP-enabled networks, as it can be integrated with packet-based approaches.

The present invention is centered around a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices, such as personal computers, portable devices, and other appliances, to synchronize content across various communication networks, including both wired and wireless connections. The framework supports dynamic attributes and file bundles to enable efficient and scalable synchronization of content. It employs dynamic attributes to prioritize download orders, download priority lists, and file actions to optimize the synchronization process. The framework also supports asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices, allowing for flexible content synchronization based on device context. The framework is highly scalable, with the ability to support multiple languages and character sets, and is deployable worldwide with support for various types of content, including files, patches, graphics, and more. The framework also provides flexibility to support content synchronization at any point in time, based on device context, and employs data compression for responses to reduce bandwidth usage. 1. The invention is a novel electron multiplier designed for use in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
2. The foil electron multiplier uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.
3. Foils are arranged collinearly, with voltage applied to each foil to accelerate electrons emitted from the back of one foil to an energy level that effectively transmits the electrons through the next foil in the series.
4. Foil electron multipliers are defined as having N foils and a resistor divider between each foil with an applied voltage V APP, for N>1, such that the potential between individual stages is V S =V APP /(N−1).
5. Foil electron multipliers are used in photomultiplier devices, where an incident particle can be directed into an electronic amplifier, whereupon the amplified pulse can be measured using detection electronics.
6. Foil electron multipliers are also used as detectors in particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
7. Foil electron multipliers have a mean gain of G N =T I T G γ I [T SE T G γ SE +1] N−1, where T I is the probability of incident particle transmission through the first foil, T G is the transmission through a single stage, T SE is the probability of secondary electron generation at the exit surface of a foil, and γ SE is the secondary electron emission yield.
8. Foil electron multipliers have a gain advantage over conventional multipliers due to the secondary electron yield from the rear surface of a foil, which is greater than that from the same surface that an incident electron impacts.
9. Ion feedback in electron multipliers is limited primarily to continuous multipliers, where ions generated by electron avalanches are typically absorbed in the dynode material and cannot contribute to further gain in the multiplier.
10. Foil electron multipliers do not experience ion feedback, as ions generated at the input surface of a particular stage are accelerated toward the previous stage, but cannot penetrate the foil.

<summary>Summary of the Present Invention</summary>

The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for the dicing of semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw. The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying a mechanical pressure to the wafer. The mechanical pressure causes a "clean break" of the wafer along the scribe lines, thereby singulating individual die on the wafer. The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting the wafer and a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad. A pressure mechanism is provided to apply the mechanical pressure to the wafer. The method is useful for singulating thousands of die on a single wafer, reducing the time and maintenance requirements of the process. The apparatus also allows for the singulation of die with different thicknesses, ensuring that the final depth of the trenches is consistent with the desired percentage of the overall thickness of the wafer. The invention also allows for the use of different types of dies, such as memory, logic, analog, microprocessor, MOS, bipolar, or any other type of semiconductor chip. The trenches can be formed by partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw to the desired depth instead of performing an etch. The trenches could also be formed on the bottom or non-active surface of the wafer.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. The present invention addresses the limitations of traditional field emission display devices, particularly focusing on the challenges of maintaining a stable and efficient emission process in the presence of ionized gases.
2. The invention includes a novel protection structure for field emission elements in a field emission display device, which significantly reduces the risk of burnout damage due to electrical current surges.
3. The protection structure consists of multiple reduction plates or electrodes, typically provided on the cathode, which are elongated and parallel to rows of field emission elements, allowing for the deflection of ionized gases away from the cathode.
4. The protection structure is designed to prevent surges in electrical current from damaging the field emission elements, thereby extending the device's lifetime.
5. The structure includes a bias voltage source to apply a negative voltage to the reduction plates, which attracts positive ions to the plates, thereby preventing current-induced damage.
6. The protection structure is arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration, providing a more stable and efficient emission process compared to traditional designs.

The invention addresses the need for minimizing total power consumption in home networks while ensuring that only the best qualified of available network slave nodes is promoted to the network master role, thereby continually maximizing the performance and administration of the home network and ensuring that the home network is not lost when the network master node enters into power save mode.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention addresses the challenge of determining the direction of electromagnetic radiation propagation, particularly at low elevation angles, by utilizing a unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of antennae. This unique arrangement allows for the determination of the function of elevation angle, independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient, without the limitations imposed by low-elevation conditions. The invention extends the concept of using a triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane, which can be measured by other means. The key features of the invention include:

1. A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of antennae.
2. The use of a triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane.
3. The ability to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself, particularly over selected sectors at low elevation angles.

The invention also addresses the limitations of the prior art, which relied on low-elevation conditions and ground reflections to determine elevation angles. The unique triplet arrangement provides a solution that can be used in both receive and transmit modes, offering unambiguous sector coverage and high accuracy in angle measurements. The invention is particularly useful for civil and military applications where the measurement of aircraft elevation angles is required, such as monitoring aircraft approaching to land.

Summary 1: The present invention provides a subminiature lamp assembly with a high temperature polymer surrounding the glass envelope, which is in compression contact with the glass envelope. The polymer is preferably a metal base with a rigid mold, and the polymeric material is somewhat rigid/molded and can be manually handled and used to manipulate the subminiature lamp. The polymer is also heat resistant, and the elastomer used for the seal supported lamp assembly provides (1) extended axial length sealing, (2) heat resistance, (3) ease of handling, and (4) increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
Summary 2: The subminiature lamp assembly of the present invention utilizes a high temperature polymer which directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope. The polymer may preferably derive support from a metal base. The polymeric material is somewhat rigid/molded and can be manually handled and used to manipulate the subminiature lamp. A fluoroelastomer is a preferable type of elastomer which has the chemically resistive properties and ability to withstand high temperature which can be advantageously employed. The elastomer used for the seal supported lamp assembly provides (1) extended axial length sealing, (2) heat resistance, (3) ease of handling, and (4) increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.

The application described in the source document is a method for configuring a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a base station of a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system. The method significantly reduces the computational cost while maintaining system capacity. The key components of the method include computing a filter matrix C using one of a plurality of alternative formulas of the invention, computing a transmit filter matrix B for a transmit filter used to process a symbol vector obtained after a decision feedback equalizing stage of the GDFE precoder, computing the feedforward filter matrix F, and computing the interference pre-cancellation matrix G. The method also involves configuring a GDFE based precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system having k user terminals, each user terminal having associated therewith a feedforward filter. The GDFE precoder comprises a feedforward path; a feedback path; and an interference pre-cancellation block denoted by I-G disposed in the feedback path, I being an identity matrix, G being an interference pre-cancellation matrix. A feedforward filter matrix F is related to the interference pre-cancellation matrix by a novel expression as described below. The method further involves configuring a GDFE based precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system having k user terminals, each user terminal having associated therewith a feedforward filter. The GDFE precoder comprises a feedforward path; a feedback path; and an interference pre-cancellation block denoted by I-G disposed in the feedback path, I being an identity matrix, G being an interference pre-cancellation matrix. <summary>Electroluminescent Display Panels with Different Color Purity and Display Color Comfort</summary>
The present invention provides electroluminescent display panels that can display images in different colors according to situations, without using an intermediate electrode. The panels can display images in green or lemon color at night time, while green light is comfortable for a driver especially at night time. The panels can also display images in yellow light at day time, which has a high luminance to cope with sun light. The panels can be made in a simple structure and at a low cost, making them suitable for use as instrument panels for an automobile. The panels can also be modified to include a red color filter to provide a more comfortable display.

Summary:
The invention provides an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, including a communication means for reproducing sound on the basis of a first electrical signal and recording sound resulting in a second electrical signal, a converting means for converting the second electrical signal into transmission data, representing sound for transmission, in a suitable data format, and a protocol means for handling and controlling communication of received and transmission data in accordance with a standardized Internet/network protocol, such as e.g. TCP/IP, and embedding and extracting said transmission and received data, respectively, in/from a data packet format according to said standardized Internet/network protocol. The terminal further comprises wireless communications means for wireless near field communication of said received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit, and an optional speech recognition means adapted to analyze and interpret said sound for recording and/or said transmission data to identify one or more commands. The terminal also comprises an energy/power source and a service server for handling and controlling the connection/coupling equipment, and a chat-line, chat-rooms, telephone meetings, etc., for facilitating communication between terminals and users.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

1. High-dielectric oxide materials, such as Pb/Bi-containing oxides, are convenient because of their low annealing temperatures and desirable properties in small grains. Pb and Bi are very reactive and diffuse into metals, leading to the formation of a low dielectric constant layer on Si. The integration of ferroelectrics and other large dielectric constant materials directly on Si is degraded by the formation of the low dielectric constant SiO2 layer (on metal). The diffusion of Pb or bismuth from ferroelectrics into an adjacent metal can be controlled by a thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric.

2. A Ge buffer layer on Si oxidizes less readily and can be used to prevent or minimize the formation of the low dielectric constant layer. An epitaxial Ge layer on Si provides a good buffer layer which is compatible with Si and also many oxides. Unlike other buffer layers, Ge is a semiconductor (it can also be doped to provide a reasonably highly conductive layer) and is compatible with Si process technology. The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of the ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is also much easier than Si which makes it possible to form three-dimensional epitaxial structures.

3. The integration of oxides on GaAs is even harder than Si because the GaAs is unstable in O2 at normal growth temperatures. An epitaxial Ge and non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric material buffer layers solve this problem and simplify the integration of Pb/Bi-containing ferroelectrics on GaAs for the same applications as listed above.

4. This method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry. The method comprises: growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate; and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.

5. Preferably a germanium layer is epitaxially gown on the semiconductor substrate and the buffer layer is grown on the germanium layer. The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer is preferably less than about 10 nm thick.

6. A second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer may be grown on top of the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide and a conducting layer may also be grown on the second non-Pb/Bi

Summary:
The invention provides a receiver input circuit that eliminates unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, taking into account adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit includes a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, and a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage. The third amplification control loop has a lower effective band width than the first two control circuits and is designed to reduce overloading of the mixer stage and frequency influences acting upon the oscillator due to powerful usable signals to which the receiver is tuned.

<summary>Summary of the Field of the Invention</summary>

The invention relates to network implemented shared workspace environments, specifically to an apparatus and method for spontaneously setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals using PC-based products. The invention is particularly useful for reducing operating costs by using PC-based products instead of dedicated conference room equipment. The system includes a collaboration indicator and a collaborative button, which can be activated by pressing the button to initiate a collaborative work-share environment. The invention is applicable to both two-party and multiparty collaborative environments, and can be implemented in a variety of networked environments, including corporate LANs, WANs, and the Internet. The system can be implemented by remote computers connected over a network, and the invention can be implemented by a computer program operating on a computer. The invention encompasses a computer program and any form of carrier medium which can carry the computer program, including a storage medium such as a floppy disk, CD ROM, programmable memory device, or magnetic tape, or a signal such as an optical signal or an electrical signal carried over a network such as the Internet.

Summary 1: The present invention provides a method for processing pictures intended to insert an advertising clip at a point, called insertion point, between two pictures of a sequence of video pictures, called video sequence, comprising the following steps:
1. Generating a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point.
2. Generating, for each advertising clip of a set of advertising clips, a salience map, determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip.
3. Selecting, among the set of advertising clips, the advertising clip having the highest degree of similarity, inserting the selected advertising clip into the video sequence at the insertion point.
Summary 2: The invention also relates to a device for processing pictures intended to insert an advertising clip at a point, called insertion, of a sequence of video pictures, called video sequence, comprising:
1. Generating a salience map representative of the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point.
2. Generating, for each advertising clip of a set of advertising clips, a salience map, determining the degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of the advertising clip.
3. Selecting, among the set of advertising clips, the advertising clip having the highest degree of similarity, inserting the selected advertising clip into the video sequence at the insertion point.

<summary>Summary of the Field of the Invention</summary>
The invention addresses the challenge of preventing localized high electrical fields at intersections with lower electrical breakdown in very small dimension semiconductor devices, particularly in high speed and high density integrated circuit applications and chip interconnect structures with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators. The key features include a recessed mask structure that positions a differentiating or mask member below the surface to planarize, reducing lateral leakage current and enhancing dielectric properties. The invention is particularly useful in damascene type structures where adjacent conductors are lined with an electrically conductive and diffusion barrier film, and connections are made through metal filled vias to lower the dielectric constant and improve interconnects. The summary also highlights the benefits of the recessed mask structure, including lower capacitance and improved interconnect performance.

1. The invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down-converting analog-to-digital converter.  
2. By placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, the predictive loop filter can be implemented using DSP techniques, thus reducing the complexity of the overall converter.  
3. The predictive loop filter is designed to generate a prediction of the input signal, which is then used to construct a digitally represented prediction of the modulated IF input signal.  
4. The dynamic range performance of the digital predictive encoder is further extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to generate the signal for controlling a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.

6. The implementation of the predictive loop allows for the flexibilities offered by these techniques to adapt the characteristics of the digital predictive loop to match those of the input signal, thus achieving higher dynamic range and lower quantization noise performance.  
7. The dynamic range performance of the digital predictive encoder is further extended by utilizing the digital output of the loop to generate the signal for controlling a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input.

9. The implementation of the predictive loop allows for the flexibilities offered by these techniques to adapt the characteristics of the digital predictive loop to match those of the input signal, thus achieving higher dynamic range and lower quantization noise performance.

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. The present invention provides a method for preparing a superconducting device, which utilizes a blocking film to prevent the removal of oxygen from the surface of the superconducting material, thereby maintaining the superconducting state at the surface close to the surface of the oxide superconducting material.  
2. The method involves forming a blocking film on the surface of the superconducting material using a photo-CVD method, which is superior in stepped coverage.  
3. The blocking film is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that portion.  
4. The method also includes adding an appropriate amount of oxygen to the inside surfaces of the superconducting material that tend to become oxygen deficient, to control the oxygen concentration at the surface.  
5. The superconducting material is then heat treated to position the oxygen at the surface or close to the surface, resulting in a highly reliable surface utilizing device.

Summary:
The present invention provides an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination. The apparatus includes a base structure for stabilization and a clamping arrangement to grasp the foam sheet specimen without damaging it. The foam sheet can be advanced through the apparatus a prescribed amount and a planar surface is provided for interaction with a cutting knife. The apparatus permits precise measurements of the cell structure within the foam sheet and provides a method for examining the individual cells in detail.

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. The invention relates to seismometers designed to operate on the ocean floor, particularly ocean bottom seismometers (OBS), and more specifically to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by such a unit during its operation and for leveling seismic motion detectors carried by such a unit.  
2. The invention comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer. Seismic motion detectors such as geophones are commercially available from numerous sources and are in themselves beyond the scope of this invention. Generally, each such detector has a preferred operating axis either vertical or horizontal and will sense the component of motion occurring along an axis parallel to its operating axis. Thus, three orthogonally positioned detectors, one vertical and two horizontal, are needed to fully sense all components of seismic motion. Depending upon the nature of the geological investigation being undertaken, as few as one detector may be used. Means must be provided to align the vertically and horizontally operating detectors, where used, parallel and perpendicular to the vertical, respectively, for operation. Because of the nature of their remote operation, OBS's require self-leveling means for their seismic detectors.  
3. The invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors, when employed as the pendulum weight, for proper operation. The pendulum weight is suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat to form a free moving pendulum. A spring loaded plunger, positioned above the ball, is restrained from contact with its surface by a pin which passes perpendicularly through the plunger and is connected to a linearly acting solenoid. After the seismometer has been positioned for operation, the solenoid is activated by appropriate means causing the pin to be pulled from the plunger which, under the force of its spring, extends to contact the surface of the ball locking it, the shaft and detector(s) in their positions.  
4. The invention also comprises a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors, when employed as the pendulum weight, for proper operation. <summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention provides a humidity sensing element that can be energized or excited by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation, does not depend on mechanical movements, is physically sturdy and requires no special physical protection, is not affected by fingerprints or reasonably dirty environments, is non-hygroscopic so that moisture only permeates the element and is not attracted by it nor collected in it, has a response time on the order of one second, and is manufactured by a method comprised by a novel combination of familiar and non-exotic manufacturing methods.

<summary>Summary:</summary>1. The present invention provides a force transmission structure comprising a drive plate and a shaft, where the drive plate has a mounting hole and a shaft fitted to the mounting hole for rotation with the drive plate. The drive plate comprises a body and a coupling formed at the center of the body, the coupling is deeper than the body in the axial direction of the body, the mounting hole being formed in the coupling. The coupling has buffer holes respectively located between adjacent sections. The drive plate has a plurality of protrusions formed on a first side of the body and configured to engage with a driving member, the shaft further comprises a pinion configured to drive a driven member. The drive plate further comprises a plurality of ribs formed at an opposite second side of the body. The mounting hole and the toothed portion are Y-shaped. The drive plate is made of a plastics material. The damper is made of rubber. The shaft further comprises a pinion for driving a gear of a window lift system. The shaft is held captive within the mounting hole by a circlip located within a groove in the distal end of the toothed portion. The Y-shaped toothed portion of the shaft extends through the inner ring of the worm gear to be fitted in the Y-shaped mounting hole of the drive plate. The drive plate drives the shaft to rotate by the Y-shaped mounting hole of the drive plate mating with the Y-shaped toothed portion of the shaft. The buffer holes aid molding of the drive plate by providing relief when the plastics material is cooling in the mould to reduce distortion of the mounting hole. The present invention solves the problems of the conventional gear train and provides a novel force transmission structure for a motor assembly.

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver, which includes an antenna, a radio frequency subsystem, and a baseband subsystem. The mobile time reference is generated using a high frequency clock and a low frequency clock, with the low frequency clock being phase locked to the high frequency clock. During active mode, the mobile time reference is provided to the primary sync searcher, secondary sync searcher, gold code searcher, and SPP controller, while during idle mode, the mobile time reference is provided to the TCXO and FRC. The mobile time reference is maintained using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and it continues to be generated using the high frequency clock and the maintained mobile time reference as a starting point. The method also includes a method of providing a mobile time reference, which includes providing a high frequency clock, providing a low frequency clock, generating a mobile time reference using the high frequency clock, maintaining the mobile time reference using the low frequency clock when the high frequency clock is not available, and continuing to generate the mobile time reference using the high frequency clock when the high frequency clock is again available.

<summary>Summary</summary>  
1. Our invention contemplates a helmet liner in which a plurality of layers, each of which consists of an elastic thermoplastic sheet formed with an array of pockets, are arranged in superposed contacting relationship with one another, with the pockets being open and unfilled to allow their deformation in response to compressive contact with an adjacent layer.  
2. The liner is fitted to an individual wearer's head by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the wearer's head to deform the sheets to the proper extent, and removing the liner from the wearer's head when the liner has cooled to a rigid, nonplastic state.  
3. By leaving the liner pockets open and unfilled rather than filling them with relatively imcompressible spacer elements, we are able to provide a helmet liner which, while sufficiently rigid to provide the necessary spacing between the outer shell and the wearer's head, is nevertheless compliant enough to smooth out the effects of relative layer alignment.  
4. The pockets of a given layer do not have to be maintained in register with the spaces between the pockets of an adjacent layer, and the manufacturing process can be therefore greatly simplified.  
5. Because of the increased bulk compliance of the assembled liner, our liner also conforms more readily to the contours of the wearer's head, minimizing the tendency for the outer helmet to shift in position.  
6. By having the liner pockets open and unfilled, we are able to eliminate the drawstrings used in the previous liner to maintain the liner in tension during size adjustment.  
7. Our liner, by contrast, need merely be maintained in compression during the fitting procedure to deform the layers to the proper extent.

<summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and a method for fabricating such a structure. The multiorifice structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods interspaced with cylindrical members. Each successive layer of rods is disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the fused assembly. The fused assembly is then cut into relatively thin wafers, and the interstices formed between the fused layers of rods and the cylindrical members form a plurality of angularly disposed passageways. The thickness of the wafer is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices and is sufficient to impart to the fluid passing through the interstices a directional component parallel to the angular displacement of the rods with respect to the common axis of the structure. The invention also includes a flat multiorifice spray plate for a fuel injector valve in which the fuel passing through the spray plate is ejected at an angle which is a function of orifices distance from the center of the structure. The method for making the multiorifice structure comprises fusing concentric layers of alternating cylindrical members and angularly disposed rods into an integral assembly, and slicing such integral assembly in a direction normal to the axis of said cylindrical members to produce a plurality of multiorifice structures wherein the interstices between said rods and cylinders form a plurality of angularly disposed passageways.

Summary:
The invention provides a method of fabricating a semiconductor device by which the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall is improved. Another embodiment of the invention fabricates a semiconductor device in which an LDD structure can be formed by a low temperature process. Another embodiment of the invention fabricates a semiconductor device by which degradation of the transconductance and increases of the resistances of elements such as the gate electrode due to hot-carrier injection into the oxide portion on the gate sidewall are prevented.

<summary>Summary:</summary> 

1. The present invention provides an improved radio telephone that can be connected to a PC and used as an improved IP telephone, offering significant advantages over conventional IP telephones.
2. The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder that operates at low power consumption and allows it to be used with a relatively low-performance PC for effective IP telephony.
3. The enhanced radio telephone handset is connected via a cable to a serial or parallel port of a PC running a streamlined software telephony application. In alternative embodiments, a wireless infrared (IR) or short-range radio connection is used for communication between the enhanced radio telephone and the PC.
4. The enhanced radio telephone is switched between ordinary wireless (e.g., cellular) operation and IP-telephone operation either manually (e.g., via a pushbutton on the radio handset) or automatically from the PC (e.g., via an option in the telephony application running on the PC).
5. The enhanced radio telephone is also used for wireless data communication in order to carry IP speech. In other words, coded speech is passed from the enhanced radio telephone to the PC where it is formatted according to an appropriate UDP/IP network protocol, and the resulting IP speech is passed back to the enhanced radio telephone for transmission to a computer network via a wireless network interface.
6. The present invention provides an improved IP telephone that is more convenient, economical, and efficient compared to conventional IP telephones. These and additional features of the present invention are explained in greater detail hereinafter with reference to the illustrative examples which are shown in the accompanying drawings. Those skilled in the art will appreciate that the described embodiments are provided for purposes of illustration and understanding and that numerous equivalent embodiments are contemplated herein.

The invention pertains to scraped surface heat exchangers, particularly in the context of vertically oriented scraped surface heat exchangers. The invention provides a blade for mounting to a drive shaft, while still using a pin type connection. The blade includes a blade body with a first side and a second side, a scraper edge and a hinge edge, and at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body. The blade is pivotally connected to the drive shaft using L-shaped locking tracks, which interfere with the pin to prevent lateral movement. The blade is also provided with a locking mechanism on both sides of the blade, which prevents the blade from sliding downward and maintaining the correct orientation. <summary>Summary of the Invention</summary>

The invention relates to a simplified connection system for high voltage cables, including an interface between a cable end and an apparatus or accessory. The interface can be obtained using an inner cone, an outer cone, or a slight inner cone concept. The outer cone concept separates the cable connection from the apparatus, reducing the risk of faults at one side. The inner cone concept has the advantage of a shorter solution outside an SF6 cubicle, while the outer cone concept simplifies complete alignment of meeting surfaces without risking glow discharges. The invention also offers advantages over conventional terminals, such as compact design, lower material and installation cost, complete independence between gas insulated switchgear and cable installations, standardization, and factory testing and quick installation.

<summary>Switching Circuitry for High-Efficiency, Low-Emission Driver Circuits</summary>

1. <summary>Charge Pump Circuits</summary>
   - Charge pumps typically operate at high energy efficiencies but don't provide sufficient current for larger displays.
   - Charge pump circuits can be modified to provide higher current by creating multiple paths with opposite current directions.

2. <summary>Switching Regulators</summary>
   - Switching regulators can be modified to reduce EMI by creating multiple paths with opposite current directions.
   - The parallel paths can cancel out radiated noise from each path, reducing EMI.

3. <summary>Direct Voltage DC (DC) Generation</summary>
   - DC generation is achieved by using inductor and diode pairs.
   - The inductor stores energy and the diode reversibly switches it.

4. <summary>Switching Regulator Implementation</summary>
   - Switching regulators can be implemented using ITO for transparent, high-resistance materials.
   - Parallel paths can be created to cancel out radiated noise.

5. <summary>Alternative Implementation</summary>
   - Using terminal leads to pick up leaking fields from fully connected paths.
   - This method reduces EMI by picking up leaking fields.

6. <summary>Alternative Implementation</summary>
   - Using multiple parallel paths to reduce EMI.
   - This method reduces EMI by cancelling out radiated noise.

7. <summary>Touch Screen Driver Circuits</summary>
   - Touch screen drivers can be driven using switching regulators.
   - The touch screen can be powered by a battery, reducing EMI emissions.

The converter includes input power supply, input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, sampling circuit, output protection circuit, feedback and dimming circuit, input monitor circuit, and control circuit. <summary>System for Automatic Control of Daylight and Artificial Lighting in a Space</summary>
